desc: A normal resting heart rate for adults ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. Generally, a lower heart rate at rest implies more efficient heart function and better cardiovascular fitness
A fever is when your body temperature is higher than normal. The average body temperature is around 98.6°F (37°C).

Normal:		 systolic: less than 120 mm Hg, diastolic: less than 80 mm Hg

At Risk (prehypertension):			systolic: 120–139 mm Hg, diastolic: 80–89 mm Hg

High Blood Pressure (hypertension):			systolic: 140 mm Hg or higher, diastolic: 90 mm Hg or higher

BMI 							 Weight status

Below 18.5:				 Underweight 

18.5–24.9:	 				Healthy

25.0–29.9:	 				Overweight

30.0 and above:					Obese
